alert.note: Alert for Anoka; Sherburne; Wright (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 24 at 3:33AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Wright, northwestern Anoka and eastern Sherburne Counties through 400 AM CDT... At 333 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Zimmerman, or 17 miles northeast of Buffalo, moving southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Elk River around 340 AM CDT. St. Francis around 350 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Otsego. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 10 in Minnesota between mile markers 204 and 215. U.S. Highway 169 between mile markers 159 and 171. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
